channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12348] preModifyColumn and preDeleteColumn in AC denies user to perform its operation though it has required rights
item.description:
A user with ADMIN and CREATE rights only on the column family is denied from performing DeleteColumn and ModifyColumn operations on the table.

also

Family name can be added in audit log for addColumn

alter 't', 'd2'

2014-10-27 20:44:45,635 TRACE SecurityLogger.org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.AccessController: Access allowed for user ashish; reason: Table permission granted; remote address: /10.18.40.106; request: addColumn; context: (user=ashish, scope=t, family=, action=ADMIN)
item.summary: preModifyColumn and preDeleteColumn in AC denies user to perform its operation though it has required rights

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Patch for master branch.
Some one please review.

Tested manually.
Below are the logs generated for operations after applying the patch.

alter 't', NAME => 'd', VERSIONS => 5

2014-10-27 21:07:07,828 TRACE SecurityLogger.org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.AccessController: Access allowed for user ashish; reason: Table permission granted; remote address: /10.18.40.106; request: modifyColumn; context: (user=ashish, scope=t, family=d, action=ADMIN)



alter 't', 'd2'

2014-10-27 21:07:44,310 TRACE SecurityLogger.org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.AccessController: Access allowed for user ashish; reason: Table permission granted; remote address: /10.18.40.106; request: addColumn; context: (user=ashish, scope=t, family=d2, action=ADMIN)



alter 't', NAME => 'd2', METHOD => 'delete'

2014-10-27 21:08:08,926 TRACE SecurityLogger.org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.AccessController: Access allowed for user ashish; reason: Table permission granted; remote address: /10.18.40.106; request: deleteColumn; context: (user=ashish, scope=t, family=d2, action=ADMIN)

This message is automatically generated.

As we have the ACL permissions model set up today "column family ADMIN" is legal, so I'll commit this later today unless objection.

I think we may want to change this in another issue, though, because it is strange IMO to have users in charge of individual column families when schema modification is a table-level activity, in that each CF schema change rewrites table descriptors, and if online schema changes are disabled then the "column family ADMIN" won't have permission to enable and disable the entire table.
/cc Matteo Bertozzi Srikanth Srungarapu
I did a naive port of this patch to 0.98 and the new test failed. Will need a 0.98 patch here. Moving out of 0.98.9

Attached a new patch for master which will apply on 0.98 also.
I checked the test case failure on 0.98.
It was because in preAddColumn we will add a new CF and checking that family for ADMIN rights was not correct so changed it back to null.

Hi Andrew Purtell
When I run the tests locally it passes all the time with the patch.

Running org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.TestAccessController

I am not sure what I am missing! Anyways I have attached a 0.98 version patch.
Sorry for bothering you again.

TestFastFail failed after commit of this in https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/5927 and https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-1.0/586/. It passes repeatedly when run in isolation with latest master and branch-1.
We have another commit to master and branch-1 on HBASE-12696, watching the build result there.
I looked at TestFastFail and don't see how an AccessController only change can affect it, there are no security coprocessors installed for that test (not that I expected any)
TestFailFast passed in https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-1.0/587/

It is passed in Trunk also, https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/5928/
